sentences.en: Deliberately broadcasting enemy propaganda to our troops is treason.
sentences.cn: 故意向我军广播敌人的宣传是叛国行为.

sentences.en: Dissatisfaction often leads to outright treason.
sentences.cn: 政治上的不满常常导致断然的背叛.

sentences.en: Don't you raise your hand to me! It's high treason.
sentences.cn: 你敢对我动手! 那叫大逆不道.

sentences.en: He was beheaded for high treason.
It's bad judgment, but it's not treason. I think treason is too strong a word.
sentences.cn: 这是一次判断失误，但不是叛国。我认为说叛国太过了。

sentences.en: She was arraigned for high treason.
The Congress shall have power to declare the punishment of treason.
sentences.cn: 国会有权宣布如何惩罚叛国罪.

sentences.en: The days of treason were over.
The defendant was convicted of high treason (= treason of the worst kind ) and sentenced to death.
sentences.cn: 被告被判犯有严重叛国罪，并处以死刑。

sentences.en: The public prosecutor charged treason against the prisoner.
sentences.cn: 检察官指控该罪犯叛国.

sentences.en: The waves of four months had rolled over the trial for treason.
sentences.cn: 叛逆案的风波已经过去了四个月.
他们控告他犯了叛国罪.

sentences.en: Thirteen people have been charged with treason — an offence which can carry the death penalty.
sentences.cn: 13人被控犯有叛国罪——一种可处死刑的罪行。

sentences.en: You know treason is a capital offence.
sentences.cn: 你知道背叛是一种严重的罪行.

words.tran_cn: 叛逆的；谋反的；犯叛国罪的

trans.tran_en: the crime of being disloyal to your country or its government, especially by helping its enemies or trying to remove the government using violence
